ARABIC: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا جَزَآءًۢ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Such people are the Companions of the Garden, remaining in it timelessly, for ever, as repayment for what they did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They are men of Paradise where they will abide for ever as a recompense for what they had done.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They are the people of Paradise. They shall remain in it forever as a reward for their deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will be the dwellers of Paradise wherein they will live forever as a reward for what they have done.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They are the People of Paradise, abiding in it forever; the reward of their deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Such shall be the dwellers of Paradise, abiding therein (forever) -- a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: These are the dwellers of the garden, abiding therein: a reward for what they did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Those are the inhabitants of Paradise, therein dwelling forever, as a recompense for that they have been doing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Such are rightful owners of the Garden, immortal therein, as a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: it is they who are the people of Paradise, they shall abide therein as a reward for all that they have done.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Those are the fellows of the Carden: abiders therein: a recompense for that which they have been working.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They shall be the inhabitants of paradise, remaining in it [forever]—a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Such shall be Companions of the Gardens, dwelling therein (for aye): a recompense for their (good) deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Such shall be the dwellers of Paradise, abiding therein (forever), a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Those, they shall be for ever the inhabitants of Paradise, a recompense for what they did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: These are the inhabitants of Paradise, where they will dwell forever—a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Those are the companions of Paradise, abiding eternally therein as reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [46:14] Those will be the inhabitants of Paradise, abiding therein (khālidīna fīhā is a circumstantial qualifier) as a reward (jazā’an is in the accusative as a verbal noun, because of the implied verbal action, that is to say, yujzawna, ‘they will be rewarded’) for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Such are rightful owners of the Garden, immortal thereafter) they will dwell therein forever, never to die nor leave it (as a reward for what they used to do) and say in the life of the world.
